messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Pronouncing Words  Was: Worry about pessimism?
messages.msgSnippet: Here some of my interesting words: macabre:  ma ca bray North of us in Idaho is Lake Pend Orielle.  I say Pend
messages.messageBody:
<<<I thought it was pronounced...>>>>

Here some of my interesting words:

macabre: ma ca bray
North of us in Idaho is Lake Pend Orielle. I say Pend Oriole....should be Pon do ray!
In college we were asked to write a paper on Euthanasia....why the heck did we need to write a paper on Youth In Asia!!
Teri




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Pronouncing Words  Was: Worry about pessimism?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/14/2004 3:50:42 PM Central Standard Time, ... never ever  heard.   Here is my list: brusque (brewsk) horizon   (short I sound)
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/14/2004 3:50:42 PM Central Standard Time,
SandraDodd@a... writes:

>>>>> Some people have DOZENS of words they know visually but have
never ever heard. >>>>>

Here is my list:

brusque (brewsk)
horizon (short I sound)
picturesque (pictures cue)
scheme (sheem)

and Hermione ( her - me - own - ee )


This thread also reminded me that when I was taking World History
freshman year (maybe 102??), the Prof. kept referring to
Catholicism. I went for probably two weeks before I figured out what
he was saying.

I thought it was pronounced Catholic ism.


>>>>>>> But in some other churches people can learn a lot of words in
church. >>>>>>

I guess Catholicism was never mentioned at mine < g >

Mercedes
